author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In Yellen's words of truth doth lie,
A quest'n in the court, so sly,
The fourteenth law, mayhaps, they bend,
To halt default by sooth, they fend.

'Midst gleaming met'ls' slipping tide,
In Lond'n, deuce they fall astride,
Gold futures weak, as Greenback shines,
Awaits the PPI's signs.

Of sterling's fate, the Bank doth steer,
A change foreseen but slight, my dear,
Upon the morrow, quarter score,
With calm, the market shall endure.

feedItems.title: Yellen Doubts Biden Administration Can Avoid Default Without Congress
feedItems.description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said it was “legally questionable” whether the Biden administration could rely on the 14th Amendment to effectively ignore the debt limit.

feedItems.title: Metals Slip Ahead of US Producer Price Inflation Data
feedItems.description: Base metals prices were close to 2% lower in London, with gold futures slightly weaker, as the dollar strengthened, and as traders looked to today’s PPI data, after Wednesday’s CPI print pointed to a softening in headline inflation.

feedItems.title: BOE Decision Seen Having Contained Impact on Sterling
feedItems.description: The BOE interest-rate decision is unlikely to be a game changer for sterling, ING said, a 25bp rise is fully priced in for Thursday’s decision.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of Takeda's profit, I gladly sing,
In fiscal-year, a gain it brings,
Their key business, hath bloomed and grown,
God's blessings, upon them, hath been shown.

Now, Honda Motor, sadly, doth bemoan,
In quarter fourth, its net profit known,
With China's sales, declining sore,
And cost rising, hence profits lower.

Rolls-Royce traders, hopeful, stated,
Their wealth, in God's hand, well fated,
Reviews in progress, plans set ahead,
In proper course, their fortunes wed.

feedItems.title: Takeda's Fiscal-Year Profit Rose Sharply
feedItems.description: Takeda Pharmaceutical’s fiscal-year net profit jumped, mainly thanks to solid growth in its key business areas.

feedItems.title: Honda Motor Profit Fell on Weaker China Sales, Higher Costs
feedItems.description: Honda Motor said fourth-quarter net profit fell 10% from a year earlier owing to a drop in China car sales and higher costs.

feedItems.title: Rolls-Royce Trading as Expected, Strategic Review Progressing
feedItems.description: Rolls-Royce said its financial performance for the year to date was in line with expectations and that the strategic review of the group was on track, with the details, together with medium term targets, due in the second half of this year.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In lands of sea and industry's might,
Indonesian nickel raises a fright,
Upon the seabed, resources we seek,
To build our future, strong and sleek.

By SoftBank's woes, a tale of loss,
Their fortune wanes, as storms do toss,
In Alibaba's realm, they sought to hold,
But turned to chaos, brash and bold.

Alas, poor Bayer, their gains do shrink,
As glyphosate's price falters on the brink,
The fires of inflation cloud their sight,
Guidance met at the edge of light.

feedItems.title: Pro Take: Can Nickel, Cobalt and Other Battery Metals Be Sourced Sustainably?
feedItems.description: Worries over environmental destruction from Indonesian nickel are being used to build the case for extracting resources from the seabed.

feedItems.title: SoftBank Group Posts $7.2B Loss, Hit by Tech Funds Woes
feedItems.description: SoftBank Group posted a fiscal-year net loss as losses from its technology funds business offset gains from the unwinding of its stake in Alibaba Group.

feedItems.title: Bayer Sees Guidance at Lower End of Range
feedItems.description: Bayer posted lower first-quarter earnings, with results weighed by inflation and an impairment loss due to weaker glyphosate prices, and cautioned that it expected to meet the lower end of its 2023 guidance range

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In fields of Schatz, a yield doth rise,
Upside by thirty, 'fore quarter's demise,
Excessive they rally, short curve's gain,
Natixis doth speak, in gentle refrain.

Thyssenkrupp, the mighty metal's sway,
Profits doth shrink, by costs led astray,
Yet forecasts surpassed, two zero five,
Lowered orders, energy they strive.

Hapag-Lloyd, through the waters it weaves,
Weaker demand and rates decline grieves,
Outlook still firm, twenty-three foreseen,
Earnings fall low, two billion in sheen.

feedItems.title: German Schatz Yield Has Upside Potential, Natixis Says
feedItems.description: The short end of the curve, particularly the German Schatz, has an upside potential of 30 basis points by the end of the quarter, according to Natixis, which sees the recent rally as excessive.

feedItems.title: Thyssenkrupp Profits Hit by Costs But Top Forecasts
feedItems.description: Thyssenkrupp reported a 74% drop in underlying earnings to €205 million, with second-quarter results hit by lower orders and high energy and raw-material costs.

feedItems.title: Hapag-Lloyd Backs Outlook Despite Weaker Demand, Rates
feedItems.description: Hapag-Lloyd confirmed its 2023 outlook after it reported sharply lower first-quarter results, including underlying earnings of $2.4 billion, as the market normalized with declines in demand and freight rates.
